metadata.title: CVE-2024-9632 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: A flaw was found in the X.org server. Due to improperly tracked allocationsize in _XkbSetCompatMap, a local attacker may be able to trigger a bufferoverflow condition via a specially crafted payload, leading to denial ofservice or local privilege escalation in distributions where the X.orgserver is run with root privileges.

criterions.comment: xorg-server package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
